content:
this is a single endpoint from an open api spec document
it has been minified by removing unnecessary kvps
additionally common terms have been abbreviated  operationId: ScanDomainForRecords path: https://gateway.stackpath.com/dns/v1/discovery/{domain}/records content: params
name domain
desc a hostname to scan for resource records
in path
required true
schema
type str
sum get resource records
desc scan a domain for resource records this call returns the records that stackpath is able to scan at the time of execution it performs a best effort but cannot guarantee all resource records were found
reqbody
scandomainforrecordsrequestproviderconfig
type obj
props
zonednsprovider
type str
default general
desc the types of dns providers that stackpath can detect

dns provider types can trigger different logic when stackpath scans a domain
authenticationuser
type str
desc the username required to authenticate with the dns provider
apikey
type str
desc the api key or password required to authenticate with the dns provider
desc providerspecific configuration needed to scan a domain
required true
responses
200
zonescandomainforrecordsresponse
type obj
records
type arr
zoneimportzonerecord
type obj
props
name
type str
desc a zone records name
zonerecordtype
type str
default empty
desc the resource record types supported by stackpath

 empty the resource record has no type
  a the resource record translates a host to an ipv4 address
  aaaa the resource record translates a host to an ipv6 address
  cname the resource record aliases one name to another
  txt the resource record contains a descriptive string many applications use txt records for configuration
  mx the resource record defines a mail exchanger for the given host
  srv the resource record defines a service on the domain
  ns the resource record describes a nameserver that serves its domains zone and records
  caa the resource record describes a certification authority authorization that adds validation to which certificate authorities can issue certificates for a domain
ttl
type integer
format int32
desc a zone records time to live

a records ttl is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by dns resolvers use lower ttl values if you expect zone records to change often use higher ttl values for records that wont change to prevent extra dns lookups by clients
data
type str
desc a zone records value

mx record data follows the format   without s
weight
type integer
format int32
desc a zone records priority

a resource record is replicated in stackpaths dns infrastructure the number of times of the records weight giving it a more likely response to queries if a zone has records with the same name and type
desc a dns zone resource record as imported from a 3rd party provider
desc the resource records stackpath was able to scan from the domain
desc a response from a request to scan a domain for its resource records
